p: Our regional modeling indicates that climate change will exacerbate future air pollution mortality in China. This finding is generally consistent with previous studies despite differences in modeled time periods, scenarios, regions, climate-chemistry models used, and population and baseline mortality projections ( 25, 26). For example, climate change is also expected to negatively affect air quality in the United States, but compared with the United States, we project roughly an order of magnitude more climate-induced air pollution-related deaths in China ( 27).
